section.title: Introduction
section.para: With the application server running, proceed to the KPME Maintenance Portal:
This chapter will cover the administration of CORE KPME business objects, located in the HR/Payroll link grouping found on the left hand side of the page.
We will also need to create an object linked in the Administrative grouping located at the bottom left of the maintenance portal.

In-depth Leave Management and Timekeeping administration are covered in subsequent guides, however, will require understanding of concepts and objects presented in this chapter. This chapter also makes a few assumptions on readers knowledge and existence of basic rice objects and components. For instance, Person Maintenance, documented within the Kauli Identity Management guide.

section.title: Institution
section.para: Institution is required by a number of HR/Payroll related objects, such as Salary Group.

row.entry: The date the institution record takes effect
Alpha-numeric code used to identify the institution. Ex: ISU
Indicator specifying whether the institution will turned active or inactive on the given effective date.

section.title: Location
section.para: Location, like Institution, is also required by a number of HR/Payroll objects, including Salary Group and other, more fine-grained location-based objects, such as Department

row.entry: The date this Location will go into effect. This date should be on or before any role members defined for the location.
Alpha-numeric code used to identify the location. Ex: IA
The timezone in which this location resides
Indicator used to activate or deactivate the location.

section.title: Location Role Member
section.para: This Role Member consists of a principal paired with a role. Depending on the role, the principal may be given elevated permissions not otherwise available to them, such as availability of specific earn codes, or the ability to view calendar documents across all departments the location encompasses.

row.entry: This date should be on or after the effective date of the Location object to which it is attached.
This field selects the person to receive the role for the location
Read-only field populated from Principal Id
Specifies which role to give to the principal for the location. Roles are divided between "Time Location" and "Leave Location" and further divided by Administrator and View Only Permissions
Optional field to specify a date for which the role is to be removed from the princpal. If left blank, the role will not automatically expire.

section.title: Department
section.para: A Location is partitioned into Department(s). Department may be given additional properties not applicable to the broader location, and Work Areas are defined within a Department.

row.entry: The date the Department record will go into effect.
An alpha-numeric code used to identify the department
The Location to which this department belongs
Optional field to specify an Administrative Chart
Optional field to specify an Organization
Flag indicating whether specific documents, i.e. Leave and Timekeeping, created within the department will go through payroll approval.

section.title: Department Role Member
section.para: This Role Member consists of a principal paired with a role. Depending on the role, the principal may be given elevated permissions not otherwise available to them, such as availability of specific earn codes, or the ability to view calendar documents across all work areas the department contains.

row.entry: This date should be on or after the effective date of the Department object to which it is attached.
This field selects the person to receive the role for the department
Read-only field populated from Principal Id
Specifies which role to give to the principal for the department. Roles are divided between "Time" and "Leave" Departments and further divided by Administrator and View Only Permissions
Optional field to specify a date for which the role is to be removed from the princpal. If left blank, the role will not automatically expire.

section.title: Work Area
section.para: The system will allow routing to be configured by the Position or a Person using the Work Area maintenance document. The work area must have at least one valid approver to route a timesheet and/or leave calendars and requests. KPME 2.0 has moved the distribute hours flag from Time Collection Rule to Work Area.

row.entry: The date the work area record is to become effective.
Auto-generated, read-only field used to uniquely identify the work area.
Long Description of the work area.
Defines the role that can edit the overtime code.

Defines the default earn code for overtime earnings. Only earn codes that are designated as an Overtime Earn Code can be used. If no earn code is submitted then overtime rule's earn codes will apply to the overtime hours.
The department this work area is associated with.
Additional description field, with a larger character limit.

Used to allow employees to clock in and out of a single assignment and the distribute hours at the end of the day to multiple assignments. Hours distribution is only available for time blocks created by the clock. KPME 2.0: This flag was moved from Time Collection to Work Area to simply use of the flag. This will avoid multiple wildcarded and overlapping rules that complicate the time collection rule.
Status of the work area checked, 'Y', indicates Active. Unchecked, 'N' indicates inactive. If the rule is being eliminated, insert a new effective dated row and uncheck the active box.
The date that this task is to become effective
A numeric value for the task
Text field used to identify the task. This description is presented to the employee when selecting the assignment to clock in or manually record their time.
Additional description field. This could be longer since it is not going to be displayed on the timesheet assignment drop down.

Status of the task. 'Y' for active, 'N' for inactive. To eliminate the task, a new effective date is entered and the field is unchecked. The task becomes inactive as of the newly entered effective date.

section.title: Work Area Role Members
section.para: A Work Area Role Member may be added via Position or Principal. A Role Member added for a Position may contain more than one principal if more than one employee is allowed to hold a single position.

section.title: Work Area Principal Role Member
section.para: This role member is assigned by principal id.

table.title: Work Area Principal Role Member Fields

row.entry: The date which the Role Member becomes effective
The principal to which the role will be given.
Read-only field auto-populated from principal id.
As of KPME v2.0, three roles are available; Approver, Approver Delegate and Reviewer. Time and Leave documents may be routed to, and specific actions can be requested of each of these roles.
The date on which this role member will be removed from the Work Area.

section.title: Work Area Position Role Member
section.para: This role member is assigned by position number.

table.title: Work Area Position Role Member Fields

row.entry: The date on which this Position Role Member will become effective
The position to which this role will be given.
As of KPME v2.0, three roles are available; Approver, Approver Delegate and Reviewer. Time and Leave documents may be routed to, and specific actions can be requested of each of these roles.
Optional date which will remove the position role member from the Work Area.

section.title: Salary Group
section.para: Salary Group is a high-level HR/Payroll object that can span multiple institutions and locations. It contains a number of properties useful for reporting and in the execution of KPME's business logic.

row.entry: The date on which this Salary Group is to go in effect.
Code used to identify the Salary Group
The institution to which the Salary Group belongs. Wild cards are acceptable.
The location in which the Salary Group is available. Wild cards are acceptable.

Maximum percentage of time worked for the salary group. When defining individual positions and jobs, the percent time will be less than the Salary Group's Percent Time. Used for leave accrual and payroll calculations, Full Time Engagement reporting, etc. Steps in increments of whole numbers. Positive amounts only, less than 100.
Yes or No field indicating whether entities within this salary group are benefit eligible.
Yes or No field indicating whether entities within this salary group are eligible for leave.
Unless Leave Eligible = "Y" (Yes), this is a required field. It is not required if the salary group is not leave eligible.

section.title: Pay Grade
section.para: Pay Grade is used to define a classification of position / job, divide groups of employees based on pay, and for the purposes of defining rules within the Time and Attendance system. Pay grade can be used to define specific shift differential rules for the employees in the identified pay grade.

row.entry: The date for which the record will become effective. This date needs to be on/prior to the date the record takes effect. When editing, it will determine the date the new values go into effect.
Text field used to identify the Pay Grade
The salary group this Pay Grade belongs to.
The instutution the Pay Grade is associated with.
The location for which this Pay Grade will be available. Wild card values accepted.

Status of the record. Checked 'Y' indicates Active, unchecked 'N' indicates inactive. If the record is being eliminated, change the effective date to when the record will be eliminated and uncheck the active box.
Minimum pay rate for this Pay Grade.
Mid Point pay rate for this Pay Grade
Maximum pay rate for this Pay Grade
Maximum pay rate for this Pay Grade at the time of hire.
Select the measurement of the pay rate ranges being defined for this Pay Grade.

section.title: Pay Step
section.para: Used to define incremental step increases within a Pay Grade. A position of a specific salary group and grade may have pay steps defined for incremental increases to the position's compensation rate.

row.entry: The date for which the record will become effective. This date needs to be on/prior to the date the record is to take effect. When editing, it will determine the date the new values go into effect.
Text field used to identify the Pay Step.
The institution for which the Pay Step should be made available.
The location for which the Pay Step should be made available.
The Salary Group this Pay Step belongs to.
The pay grade this Pay Step belongs to. This field is validated with the above salary group field, and should belong to the entered salary group.
The position along the ladder this pay step resides.
Compensation rate that will be applied to the position's pay rate. This is a baseline rate, that typically increases as the employee moves up along the steps of the pay grade.
A numerical value that, when given the units supplied by the "Service Unit" field, determines a lenth of time from an employee's service date that the pay step should become applicable.
Unit of measurement to be given to the "Serivce Amount" field.
Amount of time from position incumbent's service date to when the step is applied.

Status of the record. Checked, 'Y', indicates active, unchecked, 'N', indicates inactive. If the record is being eliminated, change the effective date to when the record will be eliminated and uncheck the active box.

section.title: Earn Codes with Earn Code Security
Earn Code
section.para: The Earn Code maintenance page is used to define codes to categorize employee’s hours/earnings and time off. For each earn code, you can define how the employees records - in/out time, hours, days or flat dollar amount. These codes may or may not be attached to an accrual category for tracking leave against available balances or simple reporting. Most earn code attributes are defined in the payroll system, but there are a few codes which need to be modified on the timesheet prior to the data being extracted to payroll. An inflation factor and inflate minimum hours value are definable on the earn code document. These actions occur on the recorded hours in the timesheet and therefore would NOT need to be done in the payroll system. Additionally there are numerous flags on the earn code to limit availability and determine eligibility for accrual and scheduling leave.

row.entry: The Effective date for which the earn code will be effective. This date needs to be on/prior to the date the rule to takes effect. When editing, it will determine the date the new values go into effect.
Alpha/Numeric code used to identify the earnings code.

This field allows earn codes to be associated with another for payroll extract. For example, you could associate all the Sick codes with the regular sick earn code and not extract the detail into your payroll system. (Sick family leave, sick injury, etc. could all be extracted.)

Determines the value that will be entered for the earn code. The Time earn code requires in/out times, The Hours earn code will require a hours amount, the Days earn code will require a days amount, and the Amount earn code will require a dollar amount.
Status of the category, checked indicates Active, unchecked indicates Inactive. If the rule is being eliminated, insert a new effective dated row and uncheck the active box.
Checked box indicates this may be used for overtime earn code. Codes with this checkbox are not available for entry on the timesheet.
Use this field to cacluate the "Worked Hours" in the Time Summary. This flag can be used by implementing institutions to develop payroll extracts.

Hours incurred will be inflated to this minimum hours value. For example, Call Back Time rules specify the employee earns a minimum number of hours, regardless of the time worked. Set an inflate minimum hours on the earn code and the employee will see the number of hours correctly on the timesheet, instead of assuming it will be inflated later.

The hours incurred will be multiplied by this factor. For example, Compensatory Time Earned (in lieu of overtime) is earned at a factor of 1.5. When the employee earns comp time, this setting will inflate the hours by a factor of 1.5 and all hours shown on the timesheet will be the inflated value. The employee will know the exact number of hours earned.
Employees with the indicated Leave Plan may have access to this Earn Code on their Leave Calendar and Time Sheet
If a category is entered the usage is validated against the employee’s balances.

Supports validating against the Accrual Category associated with the Earn Code and instruct if it adjusts the balance of that category. Usage should validate against the available balance subtract from the total. Adjustment would work without validation and add/subtract the entry.
Used when calculating leave accruals and reporting.
Define fractional unit of time used for reporting leave. Indicate number of decimals.
Used to indicate what effect time or leave reported with this earn code has on usage limits.
Flag indicating this type of leave is eligible for accrual. This applies to all accrual categories the employee is eligible for.

Flag indicating use of this earn code will affect the employee's pay and can be used by schools who are extracting data to their payroll system. When earn code is used, a notification is sent to approver and department admin.
Allow scheduling of leave on future leave calendars (i.e. weather related leave).
FLMA Earn Code indicator. If Principal HR Attributes is flagged for FMLA, employee will have option to select this Leave Code.
Workman's Comp Earn Code indicator. If Principal HR Attributes is flagged for Workman’s Comp, employee will have option to select this Earn Code.
When a user selects earn code the specified amount of time will appear in the amount of leave taken. User can change the hours as needed once populated.
Allows usage to take the balance of the Accrual Category into the negative.

note.para: Earn Codes must have an Earn Code Security entry to appear on the calendars. If an Earn Code does not have an Earn Code Security entry it will not be displayed by default.

section.title: Earn Code Security
section.para: The Earn Code Security maintenance page is used to define which roles (employee, approver) see specific earn codes on the timesheet and/or Leave Calendar. This is definable at the department, salary group or location value. These fields are accept wild cards (%).
Formerly called Department Earn Code in Timekeeping.

row.entry: The Effective date for which the earn code security rule will be effective. This date needs to be on/prior to the date the rule to takes effect. When editing, it will determine the date the new values go into effect.
If a location is defined, only entries associated with a job record in this location will be subject.
If a department is defined, only entries associated with a job record in this department will be subject.
If a salary group is defined, only entries associated with a job rcd in this salary group will be subject.
This is the code to define values for earn code.
Determines if Earn Code should be displayed on Timesheet, Leave Calendar, or Both.
The role checked can select the specified code on the time/leave entry box, if they have this role within the location/department.
Status of the department code rule, checked indicates Active, unchecked indicates Inactive. If the rule is being eliminated, insert a new effective dated row and uncheck the active box.

section.title: Earn Code Group
section.para: The Earn Code Group maintenance page is used to define groupings of earn codes. In timekeeping, these groups are also used to define the summary sections on the timesheet and in the overtime rule setup page.
Earn Code Groups can also be used to alert the user with a warning or additional information needed when using certain earn codes on their timesheet or leave calendar.

row.entry: The Effective date for which the department code rule will be effective. This date needs to be on/prior to the date the rule takes effect. When editing, it will determine the date the new values go into effect.
Text field used to identify the group.
Text which describes the purpose of this grouping of earn codes.
Text which describes the purpose of this grouping of earn codes.
Status of the earn group, checked indicates Active, unchecked indicates Inactive. If the earn group is being eliminated, insert a new effective dated row and uncheck the active box.
Text entered into this field will display on calendars and approval pages when an employee uses an earn code belonging to this group

section.title: Earn Code Group Definition
section.para: The Earn Code Group Definition Collection belonging to Earn Code Group Maintenance is used for associating specific earn codes with the group.

row.entry: The Earn Code that should be a member of this group.
Read-only field that auto-populates with the description of the earn code.

section.title: Set up Calendars for leave and pay with leave entries
Calendar
section.para: The system supports multiple pay cycles that are definable by start date/time and end date/time. This allows for institutions to define multiple pay and leave calendars such as monthly, semi-monthly, biweekly, or weekly. For example, an institution may define a pay period beginning at Noon on a Thursday which runs 2 weeks to Noon the following Thursday.

The Timekeeping and Leave Managements modules must allow for institutions to define calendars for which employees will report their time and leave. These calendars may or may not correspond to payroll calendars. For example, institutions may choose to define leave reporting calendars to be from the 15th of the month to the 15th of the following month while the payroll calendar may be from the 1st of the month to the 1st of the next month for the same employee.

The system can define calendars for Pay and Leave. These Calendars will be furthered defined by the Calendar Entries maintenance document with the reporting periods and also associated with employees on the Principal HR Attributes Maintenance Document.

row.entry: Text field used to defined the calendar entry for Pay or Leave reporting periods.
Text field used to describe the calendar.
Indicate calendar is to be used for Pay or Leave reporting periods.
This value determines the FLSA period for overtime calculations.
Time of day when FLSA period begins.

section.title: Calendar Entry
section.para: The system can define calendars for Pay or Leave. The Calendar Entry maintenance page defines the pay period (timesheet) and/or leave reporting period.
Entries must be created for a time period before a timesheet and/or leave calendar can be created.

row.entry: The calendar within which this entry resides.
Date period starts. This drives what calendar days show on the timesheet and/or leave calendar.
Date period ends. This drives what calendars days show on the timesheet and/or leave calendar.
Date batch should run to create timesheets and/or leave calendars for the reporting period.

For Pay Calendar, date batch job should run to end all timeblocks for this pay period. This inserts clock outs at the end of the pay period, and clock ins at the beginning of the subsequent pay period.
Date batch job should run to employee approve timesheets and/or leave calendars
Date batch job should run to supervisor approve timesheets and/or leave calendars
Date batch job should run to payroll approve timesheets and/or leave calendars.

note.para: To learn more about how to configure the batch Date/Time fields, please see the Batch Jobs documentation.

section.title: Pay Type
section.para: Pay Type, similar to Pay Step, defines a classification of position / job used to divide groups of employees, however does so according to payroll attributes. This attribute will also be associated with an employees job and is further used when defining rules such as Daily Overtime. Pay Type will likely be defined off of an existing payroll attribute and created at implementation time to designate different rules for different populations of employees.

row.entry: The date for which the record will become effective. This date needs to be on/prior to the date the record is to take effect. When editing, it will determine the date the new values go into effect.
Text field used to identify the Pay Type.
Text which describes the Pay Type.
The earn code which will be used to record regular time by this Pay Type.
The location to which the Pay Step should be made available.
The institution to which the Pay Step should be made available.
Indicates if Position is FLSA exmpt or non-exempt. The FLSA status of the Position's Pay Type will populate the job that is used by KPME's timekeeping and leave management modules.
Status of the pay type. Checked, 'Y', indicates Active, unchecked, 'N', indicates inactive. If the rule is being eliminated, insert a new effective dated row and uncheck the active box.

section.title: Position Base
section.para: Position Base defines a core-set of attributes associated with a position needed by Time and Attendance, and Leave Managment systems.

row.entry: Read only field, assigned when the position is created.
The effective date for which the Position will be effective. This date needs to be on/prior to the date the rule takes effect. When editing, it will determine the date the new values go into effect.
Status of the Position. Checked, 'Y', indicates active. Unchecked 'N', indicates inactive. If the rule is being eliminated, insert a new effective dated row and uncheck the active box.

section.title: Job
section.para: The Job maintenance page is used to associate a person with job attributes. A single person may have multiple jobs, but each job can have only one pay rate. Each job for a given employee is assigned a unique job number. Attributes on the job maintenance page are used to determine which Time and Attendance rules to apply, such as if the job is eligible for leave, compensation rate, etc. It is likely that these attributes will be mapped to an existing payroll/HR system.

row.entry: The effective date for which the job will begin. Changes to job attributes can be effective dated to take place in the future or past.
Used to assign a principal to the job.
Read-only field populated with the name of the principal.
Read-only auto-generated sequential number identifying the job. Unique over the set of all the employees jobs.
The department within which the job resides. This drives the available work areas when setting up assignments for this job.
The salary group to which this job belongs.
The location in which the job resides.
The pay type value appropriate for this job.
The pay grade to which this job belongs. The value in this field should exist within the salary group defined on this job.
The hourly rate for this job. Only one rate per job is supported.
The standard hours for this job. i.e. 40. Based on the value entered in this field, FTE will be calculated accordingly. I.e. 40 hours = 1.0 FTE
Derived from Standard Hours, Full Time Engagement, or FTE, is used by the accrual service to calculate leave.
Flag indicating the job is leave eligible, 'Y', or not, 'N'.
Flag indicating the job is primary, 'Y', or not, 'N'.

Flag used to indicate if the Job is FLSA exempt or non-exmpt. This field, along with Eligible for Leave, is also used to determine which calendar(s) the employee will have access to. I.e. for a non-exempt leave eligble job, the leave calendar will be made available to the employee, given the employee has a leave plan defined for them in their Principal HR Attributes.
Status of the Job record. checked, 'Y', indicates active. Unchecked, 'N', indicates inactive.

section.title: Assignment
section.para: Assignments are used to define funding attributes for a given employee's job record. An employee can be given one to many assignments, and the funding per assignment must total to 100%. Multiple assignments can be used when the employee reports to different time approvers, or when different accounts should be charged based on the work done. An employee records their hours against assignments. An Assignment is a unique combination of job number, work area and task.

row.entry: The effective date for which the job is to begin. Changes to job attributes can be effective dated to take place in the futre or past.
Identifier of the employee that is to be given this assignment.
Read-only auto-generated field populated with the name of the employee identified by the Principal ID field.
The job for which this assignment should be associated with.
Auto-generated field populated from the department of the entered Job Number.
The work area within which time will be recorded. Work area must belong to the given department. This value supports approval routing.
Optional task that can be assigned to the job.
Reflects the status of the assignment. If the assignment is being eliminated, effective date a new row and uncheck the active box.

section.title: Assignment Account
section.para: The assignment account references an administrative Account record. When attached to an Assignment, time reported for this assignment can be compensated from this account.

row.entry: Read-only auto-generated field populated from the Account Number.
The account to be associated with this assignment account.

The earn code used to extract reported time from the system. When time is reported for an assignment, the total time can be multiplied by the percentage defined on the account, and extracted along with other data to determine what amount is to be taken from each account.

Optional sub-account component of the chart of accounts to be charged when time is recorded against this work area and task. This value must be defined for the account selected to be available for entry.
Object code component of the chart of accounts to be charged when time is recorded against this work area and task.
Optional sub-object code component of the chart of accounts to be charged when is time recorded against this work area and task. Sub-object code must be associated with the object code.
Optional project code component of the chart of accounts to be charged when time is recorded against this work area and task. This value must be established on the project table.
Optional funding attribute, free form entry field.
The percent of funding this account provides to the assignment. Whole numbers, must total 100 over all assignment accounts.
Status of the assignment funding line. Checked, 'Y', indicates active. Unchecked, 'N', indicates inactive.
